Text: SupplementFERC there are a number of important orders that have come out late Friday so I will be doing a supplemental report on Monday However please note Chair Hebert announed that J Mark Robinson will head the Office of Energy Projects replacing Dan Adamson Mark has served as OEP director of EnvironmentalEngineering Review since He joined FERC in and has held various posts since then Robert Cupina is to serve as Deputy Director having most recently served as Director of the Division of RatesTariffs Central He joined FERC in Both appointments are effective immediately QCIPSMISCNRNRTXT PUC v El Paso Natural Gas RP What is interesting here is that the Chief ALJ is requesting guidance from the Commission to determine whether there should be a more complete record regarding any possibility of affilate standards The case is far more complex than originally anticipated in the March order with days of hearings three linear feet of exhibits and pages thus far in testimony Six rebuttal witnesses remain to be heard from and it is anticipated the hearing will continue all next weekDue to the complexity Chief ALJ Wagner recommends that the parties be given thirty days from June July for filing proposed findings of fact and initial briefs Further the reply briefs should be filed no later than July The ALJ on the case will issue the initial decision within days after reply briefs are filed It is requested that the Commission waive the initial decision date in this case QCIPSGASRPRPWTXT
Supplement to Weekly Regulatory Reportto the volume of orders released late last week there are some interesting orders in this supplement QuickPlacefercMainnsfhDBCBFAFCCFAAFCABAFAOpenDocument

Commission Agendabelow to access the Commission agenda for the public meeting of June publicisdsunshinehtm Items of Interest on the agenda are below CAG Northern Natural RP Expect order on compliance of the Limited Firm Throughput Service LFT on credit to Shippers when a Limited Day is called CAG Northwest Pipeline RP Expect order on changes providing for sharing of lateral facility costs between shipper and thirdparty shipper requesting service CAG Transcolorado RP Expect order on web services to more standardized name rather than proprietrary system CAG PGE Texas Pipeline PR Expect order on proposal to offer firm transportation for mile intrastate pipeline operating in Texas CAG Texas Gas RP Expect rehearing order to reconsider decision on suspension period on changes to cashout mechanism and allow proposed cashout changes to go into effect immediately CAC Vector Pipeline CP Expect order on amended presidential permit to allow gas to be exported and imported at the border into and from Canada CAC Transco CP Expect rehearing order on order dismissing Transcos request to spindown all Transcos gathering facilities to Williams Gas Processing CAC Egan Hub CP Expect order on request for expedited approval of abbreviated application for storage services Filed on June after stricken from the Commission agenda of May
Recall Commission AgendaJanet would like to recall the message Commission Agenda

Commission AgendaNorthern Natural RPNorthern states that the reason for this filing is to comply with the Commissions Order dated April in Docket No RP Pursuant to the April Order Northern has revised Tariff Sheet No A to reflect the offering of Limited Firm Throughput Service LFT in the Field Area yearround and in the Market Area during the summer April through October Tariff Sheet No D has been revised to incorporate Northerns CAG Northwest Pipeline RP Expect order on revisions to provide for the equitable sharing of lateral facility costs between a shipper for whom a lateral facility was initially constructed and a thirdparty shipper that has requested service on a relatively inexpensive expansion of the original lateral facility CAG Transcolorado RP Expect order on web site services to a more standardized name rather than the proprietary system entitled the Direct Access Request and Tracking System DART CAG EPGT Texas PipelinePGE TPLP is an intrastate pipeline as defined in Section of the NGPA operating in the State of Texas publicisdsunshinehtm

RE InterviewThank you very much I appreciate Jeff giving me a few minutes out of his busy schedule May at pm Here are some questions that are pertinent for our discussion Are there two or three experiences you look back on having been especially valuable in helping develop your leadership style Why did you find them valuable How have your views on leadership changed over time How do you think organizational changes or global changes impact on leadership styles What motivates you and how do you motivate others Do you ever have time to reflect on your leadership style in a particular instance if so what process do you use for evaluation What are the most important leadership skills for the energy industry Does leadership style change for other industries such as the airline industry or the automobile industry Original Message From Williamson Joannie On Behalf Of Skilling Jeff Sent Tuesday May PM To Butler Janet Subject RE Interview I can schedule minutes for you on Thursday May at p It would be a big help to Jeff if you could submit your questions via email prior to the interview Thanks Joannie Original Message From Butler Janet Sent Thursday May PM To Skilling Jeff Subject Interview In order to prepare a paper for my graduate class on Leadership I would like to interview you as a leader Some questions that would be of interest would be what events conspired to bring you to Enron what developmental process you knowingly or unknowingly went through in your early years and what challenges have you encountered that made a significant change in your career If you would be amenable and have the time I would like to interview you sometime next week for about minutes If you wish I could provide you questions in advance to maximize your time Thank you for considering this request

Intervieworder to prepare a paper for my graduate class on Leadership I would like to interview you as a leader Some questions that would be of interest would be what events conspired to bring you to Enron what developmental process you knowingly or unknowingly went through in your early years and what challenges have you encountered that made a significant change in your career If you would be amenable and have the time I would like to interview you sometime next week for about minutes If you wish I could provide you questions in advance to maximize your time Thank you for considering this request
